U_invest_requirements: This is a demo investor account for testing purposes. We invest in early-stage startups across all industries, with a focus on innovative technology solutions that can scale globally.
We invest in pre-seed and seed stage companies based in Kentucky. Keyhorse is the investment arm of Kentucky Science and Technology Corporation (KSTC).

As an investor, I bring value through:
- Business development support to accelerate growth.
- Strategic guidance based on hands-on experience.
- Industry connections to unlock key opportunities.
- Operational insight to help scale efficiently.
U_fund_stage: Idea (Pre-Seed), Prototype (Seed), Early revenue (Series A), Scaling (Series B), Growth (Series C/D), Pre-IPO (Series E+)

U_invest_requirements: We invest in companies at seed stage with proven product-market fit.

We invest in "waste-to-value" startups, tackling crucial environmental challenges by transforming waste into valuable resources. This alignment ensures our expertise and investments directly contribute to positive climate impact.

We invest in UK-based B2B SaaS pre-seed or seed stage start-ups. Haatch is industry-agnostic with a portfolio across applied AI, consumer, data infrastructure, edtech, fintech, future of work, healthtech, HRtech, media, product tools, proptech, retail-tech, sales enablement, and vertical SaaS. Our focus centres around evidence that the business is solving a deep pain or evidence of creating a massive impact for the customer alongside proof-of-value with a defined buyer.
U_industry: AI, Analytics, Education, Fintech, Health & Wellness, HR & Recruiting, Infrastructure, Productivity, Real Estate, Retail

We invest in promising black founders in the technology space.

At BKR Capital, we want funding to be more accessible to innovative companies led by black teams to build wealth for our community and enrich the venture capital space. Our vision is to create a business ecosystem that is more inclusive, from a portfolio perspective - through a wider number of black-led companies receiving catalytic funding, and from an investors perspective - through a wider number of young black professionals trained to become investment managers.
